Ragini's net earnings are Rs 4.5 lacs, after paying a $10\%$ broker commission. Therefore, the money Ragini received is $90\%$ of the deal price. This is because the commission is subtracted from the total price ( $100\% - 10\%$ commission = $90\%$ remaining). We can write this as an equation:
\[ \text{Net Earnings} = \text{Deal Price} \times \frac{90}{100} \]
\[ 4.5 \text{ lacs} = \text{Deal Price} \times \frac{90}{100} \]
